definition: thorn/sting/thrust/to prick/to pierce/to stab/to assassinate/to murder

sentences.english: The thief wounded him with a knife.
We report on an unusual case of penetrating tracheal injury caused by a needlefish.
sentences.chinese: 我们报告一个被针鱼刺伤穿通气管的罕见个案。

sentences.english: Though stabbed, he still seized the robber.
sentences.chinese: 虽然被刺伤了，他还是抓到了那个盗贼。
她挖苦的语言刺伤了他的虚荣心。

sentences.english: Man stabs one to death, injures 4 .
sentences.chinese: 常州礼嘉一打工者刺死一人，刺伤4人。

sentences.english: Emperor quickly flash, but the arm had been stabbed.
sentences.chinese: 隋炀帝连忙闪过，但手臂已被刺伤。

sentences.english: Improved Backstab is now called Puncturing Wounds.
Hauser died after receiving a stab wound to the chest which was possible self-inflicted.
sentences.chinese: 后来，豪泽尔死于可能是由自己造成的胸上刺伤。

sentences.english: He needled me with his heartlessness.
sentences.chinese: 他的冷酷无情刺伤了我的心。

sentences.english: Photos show a stab wound in his neck.
sentences.chinese: 照片显示他的脖子上有刺伤的伤口。

sentences.english: It was Captain Osborne that cut down the French lancer who had speared the ensign.
sentences.chinese: 刺伤旗手的法国长枪手是奥斯本上尉杀死的。

sentences.english: Hard to evenly, such as overexert, would stab scalp.
sentences.chinese: 用力要均匀，如用力过猛，会刺伤头皮。

sentences.english: And once he was nearly stung by a stingray.
sentences.chinese: 又有一次，他差一点被一条黄貂鱼刺伤。

sentences.english: Injury to organs near the ovaries, such as the bladder, bowel, or blood vessels.
sentences.chinese: 刺伤卵巢旁边的器官，比如膀胱，肠管或血管。

sentences.english: She had been stabbed and had severe injuries from blunt-force trauma to the head and upper body.
sentences.chinese: 她被用刀刺伤，头部和上身有多处钝器所致的外伤。

sentences.english: Obstinacy and self-will will always stab Jesus Christ.
sentences.chinese: 刚愎自用总是会刺伤耶稣基督。

definition: to wound with a blade or hatchet/to slash/to gash
to damage by scratching/to gash/to lacerate
to hit with a piercing blow
to hack to death/to kill with an ax
